summary: This bill, H.R. 2072, aims to allow the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) to extend the construction commencement deadline for certain hydropower projects. Specifically, it focuses on projects licensed before March 13, 2020. Upon request from a licensee, FERC can extend the construction period by up to six years, divided into three two-year periods. The bill also addresses the reinstatement of licenses that expired between December 31, 2023, and the bill's enactment date.
